Title: Katsina to settle gratuity arrears worth N20b
Summary: Katsina to settle gratuity arrears worth N20b to the tune of over N20 billion . The state added that it had put modalities in place that would see retired workers get their gratuities . The Katsina State Government has said it is putting finishing touches to settle the issue .

Title: Foundation launched to promote education, community empowerment
Summary: The Caroline Lefishetu Musa Foundation (CLM Foundation) is a non-profit organisation dedicated to improving access to quality education and empowering underserved communities . The foundation was unveiled at a well-attended event .

Title: Death toll in Hong Kong fire disaster rises to 128
Summary: Death toll from Hong Kong's worst blaze in decades rises to 128 with dozens still missing . Authorities said fire alarms in residential estate buildings had been malfunctioning . Families scoured hospitals and victim identification stations hoping to find victims .

Title: Guinea-Bissau: Deposed President Embalo flees to Senegal
Summary: Guinea-Bissau’s President Umaro Sissoco Embalo has left the country for Senegal . Embalo was detained during a military coup, the government in Dakar said Thursday . A lead opponent accused him of arranging the uprising .

Title: Trump says to suspend ‘third world’ migration after troop killed
Summary: Donald Trump said Thursday he would suspend migration from what he called ‘third world countries’ A day after an Afghan national allegedly shot two National Guard soldiers in Washington, killing one .

Title: FCTA begins enforcement actions on 1,095 revoked property titles
Summary: FCTA has commenced enforcement actions on 1,095 revoked property titles in Asokoro, Maitama, Garki and Wuse districts of the capital city . Mr Lere Olayinka, Senior Special Assistant to the FCT Minister on Public Communications and Social Media, disclosed this in a statement in Abuja on

Title: Appeal Court strikes out Nnamdi Kanu’s rights violation suit against FG
Summary: Appeal Court strikes out Nnamdi Kanu’s rights violation suit against FG . The Director General of the Department of State Services, DSS, and the AGF, were listed as respondents in the case .

Title: Hostage-swap report between villagers and bandits in Katsina communities false — Police
Summary: The villagers in turn abducted relatives of the bandits, forcing the bandits into a hostage swap, police said . “Villagers in turn forced the bandits to take hostages,” police said in a report . The report was false .

Title: Paramilitary recruitment: Board to release next phase list of successful candidates Dec. 1
Summary: Board to release next phase list of successful candidates Dec. 1 . Screening exercise for successful candidates will hold from Dec. 8 to Dec. 12, 2025, across the 36 states and the FCT .

Title: Attacker of Pope John Paul II removed from Turkish town ahead of Leo’s visit
Summary: Mehmet Ali Agca fired several shots at Pope John Paul in the Vatican's St. Peter's Square, severely injuring the pontiff . In May 1981, Turkish national Mehmet . Agca shot several shots .

Title: No contact yet with Niger school kidnappers - Bishop
Summary: The Catholic Bishop of Kontagora Diocese, Most Rev. Bulus Yohanna, has provided a detailed account of the mass abduction of pupils and teachers at St Mary’s Catholic School, Papiri . The raid occurred in the early hours of November 21, between about 1 am and 3 am, when gunmen stormed

Title: Board to release next phase paramilitary recruitment list December 1
Summary: The Civil Defence, Correctional, Fire and Immigration Services Board says shortlisted candidates for physical screening and document verification in its ongoing recruitment exercise will be released from December 1 . The Secretary to the board, Abdulmalik Jubril, in a statement on Friday, called on applicants to check the board’s recruitment portal; recruitment.cd

Title: A'Ibom airport upgrade will boost trade, tourism – Eno
Summary: Governor, Umo Eno has highlighted several socio-economic benefits that will accrue to the state following the recent approval of international status for the Victor Attah International Airport, Uyo . Eno said the upgrade will enhance trade and boost tourism . The approval was secured during a meeting between the governor and the Minister of Aviation and Aerospace

Title: Insecurity: Lagos APC backs Tinubu, says saboteurs won’t succeed
Summary: The All Progressives Congress, Lagos State chapter assured Nigerians that the nation will overcome its security challenges . The party gave the assurance in a statement issued by its spokesman in Lagos, Mr Seye Oladejo, on Friday . He urged citizens to remain calm and united despite the tension generated by recent attacks in parts of the

Title: Tinubu hails ex-PDP spokesperson Metuh at 60
Summary: President Bola Tinubu has congratulated a former Peoples Democratic Party National Publicity Secretary, Chief Olisa Metuh, on his 60th birthday . He described him as a dedicated bridge-builder and a stabilising influence in Nigeria’s political arena . Metuh served as PDP spokesman between 2012 and 2016 and has, in
